bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: a) identical with with xie xie 泄瀉① , outflow. Su wen 素問 7: 一陽發病，少 氣善咳善泄 , “When the first yang develops a disease, [patients] are short of qi and tend to cough. [There is also] a tendency toward outflow ”.
b) Identical with TPSHF 遺精 遺精 , seminal emission. Tai ping sheng hui fang 太平聖惠方 5: 小便白濁，夢寐頻泄 , “The urine is white and turbid, with frequent outflow while [patients are] asleep”.

② Pathological Condition identical with xie xie 泄瀉② , outflow. Su wen 素問 17: 胃脈實則脹，虛則泄 , “If the [movement in the] vessels of the stomach is replete, then this is distension. When it is depleted, then this is outflow ”. ③ Pathological Mechanism identical with xia xie 下泄③ , discharge with outflow. Su wen 素問 18: 乳之下其 動應衣，宗氣泄也 , “As for the movement reflected by the garments below the breast, [if it is interrupted and does not arrive, in this case] this is an outflow of the basic qi”. ④ Therapeutic Approach identical with xia xie 下泄④ , to discharge with outflow; to drain. Su wen 素問 22: 肺苦氣上逆，急食苦以泄之 , “When the lung suffers from qi rising contrary [to its regular course], quickly consume bitter [flavor] to cause its outflow ”.
